ygData.subject: Re: Swarm Intelligence and NEAT
ygData.msgSnippet: Hi As part of updating my NEAT4J framework, I m adding an automaton arena which is meant to be able to cope with scenarios such as this.  I m using ant colony

X-Yahoo-Group-Post: member; u=204774783; y=69uugErml1H7t0RJiJTTdOnniE-mql3fM6g8YRzMKwryPiMmD16gBZr6Oap_2-Cn0-57WPNF
X-Yahoo-Profile: easablade

Hi

As part of updating my NEAT4J framework, I'm adding an automaton arena
=
which is meant to be able to cope with scenarios such as this.  I'm
using a=
nt colony optimisation as my test scenario,

The reward scheme is the diffi=
cult bit as there are several goals, as
there are in swarming.  The goals I=
 set are not visiting the same
place more than once whilst not carrying foo=
d, finding food and
returning that to the nest.

Whilst the framework parts=
 works fine, I'm more interested in getting
the ACO working so I can use it=
 as an exemplar for the next release.

Has anyone done anything similar or =
just wants to chip in some advice.

In a little more detail:

Initially, th=
ere is a population, p, of randomly genrated ants which
start off in a rand=
om location within the nest.  They then set off. 
Each unique location they=
 visit (per ant) earns them a small reward. 
When they find food, they get =
a hefty reward - and this is where
things start to get a bit more complex. =
 With food, for every move
they make closer to the nest, they get a reward,=
 r, but for every move
they make away from the nest they get a penalty of 2=
r.  This then
prevents toggling around 2 positions (hopefully).  Eventually=
, they
reach the nest and deposit food, for which they receive another heft=
y
bonus.  

When an ant carries food, it deposits an amount of pheromone (w=
hich
decays at some rate).  This, I hope leads to ants, bereft of food, to
=
follow and find the food etc.  There is no reward for following
pheromone t=
rails, I wanted the ants to work that one out for themselves.

Any pointers=
 would be greatly appreciated.

Cheers

Matt
--- In neat@yahoogroups.com, "=
Mridul" <p_mridul@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
> 
> I am planning to do my MS thesis=
 on Swarm Intelligence using NEAT. In
> Ken's interview with Tom Barbalet o=
f biota.org, he mentioned that NEAT
> uses competition to weed out the leas=
t performing individuals and
> species, but they are essentially independen=
t of each other.
> 
> Is it possible to have the entities co-operate in som=
e way to obtain
> swarm intelligence? Also, I would like to expand on this =
using
> heterogeneous agents (some sort of symbiosis between agents).
> 
> =
Any suggestions/ thoughts?
> 
> Regards,
> Mridul.
> 
> PS: I am working wi=
th Tom Barbalet on NobleApe (www.nobleape.com), and
> I would like to exten=
d this to noblewarfare (www.noblewarfare.com) too.
>
